trans-unit.source: This article explains how to add fingerprint biometrics to your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to add fingerprint biometrics to your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app.

trans-unit.source: Including a request for fingerprint authentication when the user must consent to a particular action increases the security of your app.
trans-unit.target: Including a request for fingerprint authentication when the user must consent to a particular action increases the security of your app.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could require fingerprint authentication before authorizing an in-app purchase, or access to restricted resources.
trans-unit.target: For example, you could require fingerprint authentication before authorizing an in-app purchase, or access to restricted resources.

trans-unit.source: Fingerprint authentication is managed using the [**UserConsentVerifier**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279134) class in the [**Windows.Security.Credentials.UI**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701356) namespace.
trans-unit.target: Fingerprint authentication is managed using the [**UserConsentVerifier**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279134) class in the [**Windows.Security.Credentials.UI**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701356) namespace.

trans-unit.source: Check the device for a fingerprint reader
trans-unit.target: Check the device for a fingerprint reader

trans-unit.source: To find out whether the device has a fingerprint reader, call [**UserConsentVerifier.CheckAvailabilityAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279138).
trans-unit.target: To find out whether the device has a fingerprint reader, call [**UserConsentVerifier.CheckAvailabilityAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279138).

trans-unit.source: Even if a device supports fingerprint authentication, your app should still provide users with an option in Settings to enable or disable it.
trans-unit.target: Even if a device supports fingerprint authentication, your app should still provide users with an option in Settings to enable or disable it.

trans-unit.source: To request user consent from a fingerprint scan, call the [**UserConsentVerifier.RequestVerificationAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279139) method.
trans-unit.target: To request user consent from a fingerprint scan, call the [**UserConsentVerifier.RequestVerificationAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279139) method.

trans-unit.source: For fingerprint authentication to work, the user must have previously added a fingerprint "signature" to the fingerprint database.
trans-unit.target: For fingerprint authentication to work, the user must have previously added a fingerprint "signature" to the fingerprint database.

trans-unit.source: When you call the [**UserConsentVerifier.RequestVerificationAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279139), the user is presented with a modal dialog requesting a fingerprint scan.
trans-unit.target: When you call the [**UserConsentVerifier.RequestVerificationAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279139), the user is presented with a modal dialog requesting a fingerprint scan.
